bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, October 7, 1879

div1.p: Reed teases McPherson, and writes about debts, pay, and military assignments.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, October 7, 1879

opener.salute:
Most Reverend Senñor
and Dear Pillulissima:

div1.p:
Your “effusion” of the 5th
brought in by Teamster, was placed on my Of-
fice desk (ahem!) last evening, just after the
festive Sol had secreted his head beneath the wes-
-tern “rim”-(Hesche enchaw!) Your surmises con-
concerning your former letter were correct
to the letter. The same was handed to me by
Lt. Mills, just 3 hours after O'neal, or O'neil,
or O'niel, or O'neel, or O'neele or Oneale (I don't
know the correct spelling of the gentleman's name,
& hence insert a variety,) had turned his horse's
head toward the Cañon of the Rocks. Of course,
I didn't know he had gone, & as soon as I
read the letter (which was handed to me at the
Post Trader's Store- not imbibing, Dorsey, but only
went over to indulge in “los Billiardos”,) I tore over
to the Q. M. Corral to see O'n'l, & to my utter as-
tonishment, found that he was probably just
crossing Black River on his Return. So, Dorsey
dear, you mustn't blame your Uncle,
O- Permit me to announce to your
“pilluline” majesty that the Ration has
been sold by “it shall be most excellent”,
realizing the handsome Sum of $7.25-equal
to seven “Sheckels” & twenty-five one hundredths.
Five of these “pesos” were placed within the
grasp of Ah! stink, sufficing to cancel your
obligations to your his house- The remaining $2.25
you will find snugly ensconced within the
folds of this communication- Don't say that
you didn't get it, or I'll blow the top
of your majesty cranium into “smither-
-eens”! How? I send you also the medicines
called for, to be taken a bucketful 3 times
a day, on an empty stomach! Please tell
Altman that the Paymaster did not pay
his extra duty pay when he was last
here, nor Moosbrugger's either- Tell him
I will make out the necessary certif-
icates for him & Moosbruggger & send them
to Cap't. McGowan, so that he will be
able to recover his pay- What do you
mean, Sir, by speaking of going to Camp
Thomas? In the name of Moses, is your
Tyrannical Old “boss” going to make you
accompany him to Thomas? Why not
come back to Apache from Rocky Cañon?
I begin to feel as if I never would gaze
upon that “mild blue” eye again! Oh!
will some kind friend hit me with a brick
Concerning LeFevere, Certificates of Disabil-
-ity were forwarded two weeks ago, & with
a strong recommendation that a medical
officer accompany him to the old soldier's
Home. What will be done, I don't know-
There's something for you to “put in your
pipe & smoke”! How?

Your wash will be sent out, this
time, “So help me Heaven”!

Myer has just called
for letter and I must cease my
music-
